page.title: 16TYPICAL SHEEP SHEARING DAY
page.content: On our farm there are four men shearing the sheep and there are another two wrapping the sheep's fleece and one catching the sheep to be sheared.We start shearing in the middle of June.We gather our sheep the day before we do the shearing.After we have gathered the sheep we put them in a shed ready to start shearing them the next day.The next day we get up early and go to look at the sheep.We shear about five hundred a day but when we only shear about two to three hundred a day we only have two shearers.When the shearers are ready we get a sheep for them and they start to shear them.When they have sheared the sheep one person wraps the wool and one puts pitch on the sheep's back to mark them with the farmer's mark.
